column2: Check equipment installed in correct location
Checked traps & drains, flow from trays with unit running
Provision to disconnect the stack for servicing & inspection
Drain and test points to boiler flues
Correct boiler inlet gas pressure ≤7 kPa - checked against manufacturer literature
Sensors, controllers, switches fitted to flue and pipes
Wiring/tubing to devices to boiler checked
Pipe removal & clearances for tube clean / withdrawal
Sensors, controllers, switches fitted to chiller and pipes
Access covers in place and sealed
Multiple towers at same height with balance line
Side stream filtration to Supplier recommendations
Hangers (including booker rod cut back) checked
Kitchen exhaust duct graded towards hoods and drains
Kitchen exhaust duct installed with access panels (every 3 meters & change in direction) and drains
Roof cowls secured and weather proofed
Correct Model & Serial No. checked & referenced
External springs and mounts checked against schedule
Traps, drains, flow from trays checked without unit running
Unit labelled and checked against drawing / schedule
Pipe labelled and checked against specification
Control valves tags checked against drawings / schedule
VSD labelled as per drawings / schedule
Fire installation details (pass once details entered)
Manufacture details - pass once details entered
Installation checklist - pass once details entered
Traps & drains, flow from trays checked without unit running
Unit labelled and checked against drawing / schedule
Control valves tags checked against drawing / schedule
Position, height, sizing checked against drawings
Bracketing checked (to accommodate springs where applicable)
BMS Provisions located and installed correctly
Drain down points checked against specification
Pipe sleeves & fire seals checked against specification
Service Access checked against drawing / specification
Clearance for insulation & sheathing as per specification
Allowable drop kPa checked against specification
Duration hour / minute checked against specification
Initial pressure kPa - pass once entered
Final pressure kpa - pass once entered
Correct model no checked against schedule
No external forces on pump from pipework etc
Correct model no checked against schedule
Traps, drains, flow from trays checked
Installed to manufacturers instructions & approved detail
Access covers in place, sealed, pipes connected
Spring mounts checked against schedule (if required)
Sensors, controllers, switches fitted to pipe
Correct model no checked against schedule
Opening in fire rated construction built correctly
Does the structure match that for which damper was tested
Check damper orientation (i.e. upside down or not)
Is the damper mechanism within wall structure
Is the damper expansion material fitted between damper and penetration
Check that the fusible link is fitted and has the correct temperature rating
Check damper blades are fully open
Check damper closure is not impeded (drop test)
Confirm an access panel in the duct is provided and allows access to reset damper
If motorised, is the actuator fixed to the damper body (attach photo)
Confirm break away bolts / fixings have been used (plastic or aluminium) [attach photo]
Is the damper labelled with information as required by AS 1682.1 (attach photo)
Attach photo(s) around damper with flanges off, confirming clearances as required by AS 1682.1
Attach photo(s) inside damper through access panel of blades, linkage etc.
